etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Watts (1815–1884), chemist. From penta- + decyl; compare French pentadécyle

definitions: Any of the series of hydrocarbon radicals —C₁₅ H₃₁ derived from the pentadecanes; specifically the straight-chain radical —CH₂ (CH₂)₁₃ CH₃. Usually attributive or a formative element in chemical names.
